Text: RT @mallikadutt: Dreamer and builder. Can you be both? @jeffskoll in conversation with @TEDchris. #skollwf https://t.co/mLefHiQzy1
About to join about 400 brethren social entrepreneurs at #skollwf for dinner at New College, Oxford.  "New" college was founded in 1379.
RT @SkollFoundation: See @jeffskoll & others talk about #FierceCompassion at #skollwf in Oxford. Tickets: https://t.co/V3hsSvRSJc
Yay for best screenplay for Spotlight.
RT @NazaninBoniadi: "Music is a way of connecting people.. It is our responsibility to send out a message that human rights abuses must not…
@NazaninBoniadi @amnesty @goldenglobes   Great to have met you and seen who you are...you are deserving of this award and many to come.
RT @NazaninBoniadi: With fellow honoree & inspiring philanthropist @jeffskoll at @amnesty's inaugural @goldenglobes recognition brunch. htt…
Revolutions in peptides (amino acid chains) are upon us.  Epithalon, GHRP2, IGF1, etc. need to be clever, but clear benefits for so many.
Maybe by the time we live to 200+ years, we will have more than 140 characters to express the fullness of life.
The next revolution is life extension...healthy longer life due to telomere extension.  It will be mainstream in 10 years.
10,000 feature documentaries this year.  Participant did 4 and all made the Academy short list of 15.  Diane Weyermann is a superstar.
The first big awards show of the season.  Spotlight won best feature and other awards.  Look of Silence won best documentary.  Humbling.
@akimbo37 ah, too funny!   Time goes too fast.  Still in touch with Alex Rusak?  Been wondering what he is up to.
So instead, let's turn those billions of dollars of hate to peace and tolerance.  This was 1999, two years before 9/11.
How can one possibly defend against a distributed enemy with nukes.  They are more likely to turn them on you / us?
Hmmm.  My response tweet to Margaret Thatcher circa 1999, about the nuclear deterrent being the ONLY deterrent was...
In 1999, Margaret Thatcher keynoted at Stanford's Hoover Institution.  She said "the nuclear deterrent is the only deterrent...(more)"
RT @SkollFoundation: "We hit jackpot when @jeffskoll started @SkollFoundation & brought @RogerLMartin on board" @SallyOsberg. Celebrating #…
RT @Participant: David Linde Joins Participant Media as CEO http://t.co/TUgf5gsR8W http://t.co/kSdENhzBTY
RT @ThatHannahAlper: I stand #WithMalala for the right for girl's education everywhere. Will you join us? @MalalaFund http://t.co/VYDXISEUss
In 1997, I put artificial grass in my back yard in LA.  No water, looks great. But the city didn't allow it in the front yard too. Sigh!
At TIFF premiere of Spotlight, our film of the Boston Globe / Catholic Church story Speaking truth to power.  Wow, told with such artistry!
At Beasts of No Nation premiere.  A film on child soldiers, really powerful.  A credit to those who have lived through such things.
Now at our He Named Me Malala premiere in Toronto.  So very proud of Malala and Zia for their bravery and Davis for creating a great film.
Participant has 5 films at TIFF this year...Our Brand is Crisis, Malala, Spotlight, Beasts of No Nation and Yo Yo Ma.  Proud of all.
Our Brand is Crisis premiered at TIFF with George Clooney / Grant Heslov / Sandra Bullock and a receptive audience tonight.  Thanks all.
Congratulations to Roger Allers and Salma Hayak on the premiere of Kahlil Gibran's The Prophet!  Beautiful film. http://t.co/n62K4Ypeg3
On Labor Day 1995, Pierre Omidyar launched eBay.  What a life changer it has been for so many, including me.  Congratulations Pierre!
Happy 18th birthday, Malala!  July 12th, 1997, a great day for the world.  #BooksNotBullets @MalalaFund http://t.co/gJaAYo7DDQ
#HITRECORDonTV.  Yay to Joe, Jared and team for the dawn of season 2.  We love you Joe!  Jeff and your friends from Participant / Pivot!
Great! After 20 years, ACT, Colombia and the Inganos tribe, have expanded the Yunguillo reserve to cover an area the size of Seattle.
RT @MichelleWKwan: .@jeffskoll "focussing on passion, love for life and what he wants for his future daughter." https://t.co/10TjYbpJ4g
A banner Skoll World Forum, punctuated by a fire at the main hotel in Oxford during our closing plenary.  Lots of scrambling!
Lovely time in Oxford with our social entrepreneurs and Archbishop Tutu.  The opening plenary of the Skoll World Forum begins today!
On the way to the Skoll World Forum on Social Entrepreneurship in Oxford!  Should be a very inspiring week.
RT @Jemima_Khan: I'll always love Pakistan. Thanks to my sons & the love I've been shown there, I'll always feel like an honorary Pakistani…
RT @SusanSarandon: TED Talk: What the people of the Amazon know that you don’t @DocMarkPlotkin @TEDTalks http://t.co/iXhK3EnclY
http://t.co/x9IQIeeVId #WhereAreTheWomen
TONIGHT @Theelders and experts debate Women As Peacebuilders at 7pm EST LIVE from Atlanta
RT @sufisal: My friend @jeffskoll whose film company Participant has made some of the world's greatest, Oscar winning movies is making a fi…
We made the movie Contagion a few years ago to prepare society for what a real pandemic would look like.   Hope we be wary of Ebola.
Happy birthday, President Carter!   You make turning 90 look easy!  #Happy90th!
If we solve clean energy, we also solve many health probs, fresh water, poverty and food security.  This seems a message all sides like.
I was happy to give a talk at the UN Fndn dins Monday...msg: renewable energy will be least $ energy src for 80% of the world in 5 years.
RT @PaulaAbdul: Inspiring #MessageToTheWorld from my friends @musical_wheels @jimmydemers Let us all hold the space 4 #worldpeace http://t.…
@TomSteyer is doing so much for climate change.  He clearly saw the threat a few years ago and now is a true champion on this vital issue.
Join a debate with @TheElders and young people on #climatechange and leadership: next week at @sciencespo http://t.co/I3xlrVsHWs #ScPoElders
RT @MauraLONeill: AMBITION-That's what it takes to solve worlds most pressing problems  @jeffskoll &  @sallyosberg naming @SkollWorldForum …
Find out what you didn't know you didn't know about Donald Rumsfeld. #TheUnknownKnown is now on @iTunes & On Demand http://t.co/DFYXYngMQE
RT @AFineFrenzy: Please check it out! Many congrats to @diegoluna_ @chavezfilm  @jeffskoll and my friends at @_Participant #cesarchavezmovie
About to
The Great Invisible, about the BP oil spill,  won the best documentary prize at SXSW!  Congratulations to Margaret Brown, the director.
Great day of Participant panels at SXSW.  Watching Diego Luna (Chavez) and Margaret Brown (The Great Invisible) now.
On Colbert, talked about how The Cove helped end dolphin hunting in Taiji for awhile.  Has started back up again.  Must continue to fight.
I'm on Colbert tonight.  Just got finished shooting in NYC.
Goodbye to '13.  I had major surgery, almost died and found out in the end who really cared.  Tough lessons, but clarity.  Onwards to '14
#MyMandela.  The passing of Nelson Mandela is a great loss.  He started The Elders, which I've worked on for 6 years.  Amazing man, legacy.
http://t.co/nQfnOPKZpW
Watching Blue Jasmine, the Woody Allen film.  It is an acting clinic, especially Cate Blanchett.  Wow.
RT @caafoundation: Last days of Skoll #SEChallenge [by @_Participant’s @JeffSkoll, @SkollFoundation + @HuffingtonPost]! http://t.co/omL7YcZ…
I will be on 60 Minutes this Sunday on CBS in a segment called "The New Golden Age of Philanthropy" with Bill Gates and Warren Buffett.
http://t.co/IXgXx9MxIy
@pariswagner on TakePart Live.  A social entrepreneur taking on orphans in Africa. Good to see young social entrepreneurs in action!
RT @PeterDiamandis: Good People Doing Good Things - Video w/@jeffskoll on becoming a social entrepreneur via @XPRIZE http://t.co/slGNnmWbPA
I'm in Cape Town with the Elders.  Honoring Archbishop Tutu as he retires from his tenure as chair of the Elders.  We will miss him.
The Skoll #SEChallenge is live! Support innovative social entrepreneurs & leverage your gift: http://t.co/Wmgb6O3Svy
How the Power Of Storytelling is a lever for social change:   Change: http://t.co/p36foCTlab  @FastCoExist @catchafire #GenerositySeries
Saw The Square by @JehaneNoujaim last night.  It is a most impressive accounting of Tahrir Square over the last 2 years.
About to Premiere The Fifth Estate as the opening film at the Toronto Film Festival. It is about WikiLeaks and could not be more topical.
Hotel Rwanda has been playing on Pivot @pivot_tv.  It was one of the movies that inspired me to start Participant, so it is very appropriate
Tonight is the first episode of TakePart Live, our nightly news show.  It airs on Pivot Mon-Fri at midnight EST, 9pm Pacific.
Pivot launched today in over 40M homes.  Very proud of the team!
Pivot, Participant's TV network, launches on Thurs, Aug 1.  It has taken us years to get to this point.  On with the show!
When you want to go fast, go alone.  When you want to go far, go together (old African proverb).
RT @algore: T-minus 15 minutes until my live Google+ Hangout with @JeffSkoll to discuss the climate crisis. Watch here: http://t.co/q6OxI2B…
I'm about to do a Google Hangout with Al Gore on climate change, celebrating the 7th anniversary of An Inconvenient Truth.
RT @SkollFoundation: Join @jeffskoll and Al Gore June 11 at 2pm EST for a @GoogleHangout discussing  the #climate crisis http://t.co/WRRm83…
RT @algore: Join @JeffSkoll and me on 6/11 for a Google+ Hangout to discuss the climate crisis and its solutions: http://t.co/uBEb5EQE5N
Successful panel at the UN.  @paultudorjones and @muhammadyunus made it very collegial.
At the Forbes philanthropy conference in NYC. Speaking with Muhammad Yunus at the UN on market based innovations saving the world.  Gulp.
RT @algore: I invite you to learn about the #climate crisis's impact on health by joining this webinar: http://t.co/ahrIJAZcrP @ClimateReal…
Extend the Optic Nerve of Humanity: A Crowd Controlled & Funded Space Telescope. Amazing Kickstarter. Check it out!  http://t.co/RibKmw3plB
Sitting at a dinner with Mike Milken, BIll Gates and Paul Kagame of Rwanda.  Good people doing good things from different walks of life.
Busy day at #skollwf.  There are so many impressive people here.
I get up each morning determined to change the world and have a great time doing it.  Sometimes this makes planning my day difficult.EBWhite
In Oxford, getting ready for the Skoll World Forum.  Let the games begin!
Jake Eberts was just on the In Memoriam section at the Oscars.  So sad he was taken too early.
At the Oscars.  Grateful for Lincoln, No and Open Heart and 14 nominations.  It will be a fun show.
I'm co-hosting a farewell / tribute to Jake Eberts (Gandhi, Chariots of Fire) at UCLA tonight.  I miss Jake a lot.
Oops, that's 13 noms!
Happy to report 12 Oscar noms for our movies Lincoln and No...a new record for Participant Media.  Congrats to the film makers!
Twitter is like a treadmill.  The more you use it, the faster it goes.
Thanks giving is a good practice year round.
The new Skoll World Forum site is now live...congratulations to the team!   http://t.co/L6N06zw8
Harvard (SIC) & http://t.co/HtqaMGBh Girls Impact the World Film Contest for students - $20K in Prizes! Enter NOW http://t.co/zBVOXqeE #GITW
Very positive meetings in Israel.  Youth, high tech and joint entrepreneurship between Arabs and Jews very encouraging towards peace.
We live in a time of great prosperity and abundance.  But we are wired to each other in a way never seen before.  We r the new generation.
My email system went down this week.  It is like the sky fell.  We are so dependent on our tech platforms now.  Lesson learned.
I just sent a spider packing.  I didn't kill it, but it left a big web over my back porch.  It is hard to speak spider.
It is time to end subsidies for fossil fuel companies.  They simply enrich fuel companies at everyone's expense.  #endfossilfuelsubsidies
I received the Order of Canada, today.  And then received a special extra medal from the governor general.  Oh Canada!
Visit yesterday with Bill Gates regarding some new movie projects.  Talked about a next education project a la Waiting for Superman.
Congratulations to Sarah Borgman and everyone at the Skoll Foundation for another great Forum. @SkollFoundation #skollwf
"But when we connect with others, we can overcome global threats" #skollwf
Catastrophic Risk panel.  "A small group of crazies can destroy a large swath of the planet through bio-terror".  Ian Goldin. #skollwf
Social media panel... How does one deal with too much information, too little time!     #skollwf @SkollFoundation.
Nick Danziger just spoke at Skoll World Forum.  Gordon Brown and Eve Ensler coming up.  Great session. @SkollFoundation #skollwf
Hans Rosling speaking at Skoll World Forum.  Whew, I'm glad I didn't have to speak after him.  @SkollFoundation #skollwf
Good 'small' dinner for our social entrepreneur awardees tonight.  A mere 200 people.  Inspiring!   @SkollFoundation #skollwf
IDSP (builds/runs schools in Pakistan) had four boys sent to blow them up.  IDSP turned them into students.  @SkollFoundation #skollwf
Talked with a lot of social entrepreneurs today.  One had a bomb explode next to her office in Quetta (Pakistan)@SkollFoundation #skollwf
Lunch with the new Skoll Awardees - congratulations to Landesa, Nidan, Giwad Kilanga, Proximity Designs @SkollFoundation #skollwf
Landing gear failed.  Good thing it failed in the up position!  After 13 hour delay, enroute to Oxford on another plane. @SkollFoundation
On the way to Oxford and the plane broke down and landed in Goose Bay.  Looks like we are going to be late for the Forum.  :(
The Skoll World Forum on Social Entrepreneurship in Oxford is next week.  9th annual!  Always a frantic pace, but inspiring.
Two day offsite on the middle east with the experts.  Someone needs to do a movie about all this, although events are changing too quickly!
I'm at a dinner party and everybody is putting down Facebook.  So I'm writing a tweet.
Very interesting talks at TED yesterday from DARPA and U Penn.  Incredible flying machines that can go mach 20 or fly like a hummingbird.
Off to the Oscars.  Go Viola and Octavia!
Good board meeting at the Skoll Foundation today.  Gearing up for Oxford!
Off to the Grammys.  No horse in this race, but will be fun to see the show.
Antarctica was the most beautiful place I've ever been.  Penguins, seals and whales, all completely oblivious to human beings.
In the Drake Passage in Antarctica.  Major waves.   This is truly the bottom of the world.
Also, deepest respect for Al Gore.  He is both a great friend and the finest leader the climate movement has ever had.
I've had some excellent convos with the Climate Reality team today, feeling much better about the strategy.  There is a lot of good to come.
I'm not convinced I've heard the winning strategy.  Nor consulted.  And the ratio of climate presentations to seeing the Antarctic - slim.
I'm in the Antarctica with Nat Geo and the Climate Reality project.  I may be the biggest funder of CRP and it's predessor ACP.
Congratulations to Michelle Kwan on her entry into the US Figure Skating Hall of Fame.
Off to Antarctica in a few hours with National Geographic and the Climate Reality Project.  No Twitter there I would imagine.
Still at Sundance.  Looking forward to introducing the Stories of Change panel with social entrepreneurs tomorrow.
About to see @AFineFrenzy at Sundance with@swedlove.
Congratulations to my all my friends who won Golden Globes last night, especially Octavia Spencer.
Looking forward to the Golden Globes.  The Help has 5 nominations.  A welcome break from the troubles of the world!
Met with the governor of Hiroshima Prefecture last week.  He has a plan to use Hiroshima as an institute for nuclear disarmament.Very cool.
Spent yesterday on the set of our movie "Lincoln" with Steven Spielberg.  Steven is super cool.
Love spending time with @afinefrenzy.  Always special.
Had the joy of accepting the Global Humanitarian Award last night from the Sj Tech.  Nice to have @afinefrenzybr & @westcoastbill with me.
Spoke at the Global Zero conference on nuclear disarmament.  Then world will spend $1T over the next decade on nuclear weapons, a shame!
Momentum is changing fast in the middle east and Israel and the US are becoming increasingly isolated.  It is a big issue for world peace.
Waiting to see Don Henley before he goes on for his show.  Maybe he can give me and @westcoastbill some guitar lessons.
I am sitting with the lovely Michelle Kwan and Jimmy Demers reminiscing on the magical night we shared at the wedding.
Went to Amy Smart's wedding last night, it was such a great celebration.  So nice to see true love.
The Help has been #1 for almost 2 wks.  Our first #1 movie.
Go Canada in hockey tomorrow!
Saw The Crazies in theaters on opening night last night.  The crowd was very into it.
